intro: Mediocalcar decoratum, commonly known as the ornate calcar, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that display a range of vibrant colors, including red, purple, and orange. The plant has a compact growth habit with dense, silver-green foliage that reflects sunlight efficiently in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically tubular, adapted for pollination by specific species of hummingbirds and bees. Due to its unique beauty and limited distribution, Mediocalcar decoratum is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
